title: Textarea Attribute Value XSS
description: User input is inserted into a custom textarea attribute. By breaking out of the attribute quotes, an attacker can inject event handlers like onfocus to execute JavaScript.
objectives: Break out of a quoted attribute.
Inject a new event handler such as onfocus.
Trigger JavaScript execution through attribute injection.
hints: User input is placed inside a quoted attribute.
If you break the quote, you can add your own attributes.
Textarea does not auto-trigger focus naturally â€” consider forcing focus.
body:
<article>
<script>
const q = new URLSearchParams(location.search).get('q') || '';
document.write('<textarea id="txt" style="width:300px;height:150px;border:2px solid red" data-info="' + q + '">Textarea XSS</textarea>');
</script>
<script>
// Automatically focus the textarea to trigger injected onfocus
setTimeout(() => {
  const el = document.getElementById('txt');
  if (el) el.focus();
}, 300);
</script>
</article>
